chapter.title: Pre-Entry Choices 2
chapter.para: Having chosen one of the input templates, one then has to supply information on which language and script the publication utilises, which transliteration scheme one utilises if one has chosen to transliterate the bibliographical information. Choose here which transliteration scheme you follow from the list (and please tell us if any valid schemes are missing).

Obviously, the language and script of the publication relates to the transliteration question, but not in any straightforward manner, so these choices have to be made by the cataloguer. There is however a certain amount of logic between the different choices and we will see that you are only presented with relevant choices.

A similar question is which language one intends to use for cataloguing. This mainly applies to the description of the contents of the publication, which we will talk about below. Does one supply keywords in English, German or Chinese? It also applies to the extent of the publication and to its location inside its container; though there can be transliterated, the simplified input forms do not open up for this. Generally speaking, since the official language of the Cluster is English, the language chosen here should be English (and the script therefore Latin), but if one wishes to use some other language, the possibility is open.
